package.name: currency-symbols
package.author: stib
package.description: All the unicode currency symbols I could find
package.title: Currency Symbols

manifest.name: currency-symbols
manifest.title: Currency Symbols
manifest.description: All the unicode currency symbols I could find
manifest.author: stib

value.readme:
All the unicode symbols that I can find listed as being currency.
use the :$: shortcut to get a dialog allowing you to chose from a list, or for dong, euro, pounds, rupee, won yen use :- followed by the letter representing the currency or vice-versa, e.g. :-r or :r- for â‚¹ rupee. The mnemonic is that the symbol looks like the letter with a stroke through it.
For cents use :c. There are also full-width variants, use the same shortcut, but with upper case letters.
For all other currencies use :$: to bring up a menu.

packageYml.name: package.yml
packageYml.content:
# individual currenciesâ€”themnemonic is to use the letter with a hyphen to combine them into the symbol
matches:
    - triggers: [":c|", ":cent", ":C|", ":|c", ":|C"]
      replace: "Â¢"
    - triggers: [":d-", ":-d", ":D-", ":-D", ":dong"]
      replace: "â‚«"
    - triggers: [":e-", ":-e", ":E-", ":-E", ":euro"]
      replace: "â‚¬"
    - triggers: [":-l", ":l-", ":pound"]
      replace: "Â£"
    - triggers: [":-L", ":L-", ":Pound", ":POUND"]
      replace: "ï¿¡"
    - triggers: [":r-", ":-r", ":rupee"]
      replace: "â‚¹"
    - triggers: [":w-", ":-w", ":won"]
      replace: "â‚©"
    - triggers: [":W-", ":-W", ":WON"]
      replace: "ï¿¦"
    - triggers: [":y-", ":yen", ":-y"]
      replace: "Â¥"
    - triggers: [":Yen", ":YEN", ":Y-", ":-Y"]
      replace: "ï¿¥"
# type :$: to bring up a menu for these
    - trigger: ":$:"
      label: "AFGHANI"
